fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62247].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When users tick the check box to collect browser info in Issue Collector's configuration page, it now has a below message (check box) in the feedback page. 
- !image-2016-08-16-22-11-22-264.png|thumbnail! 

This would give customers an option whether to include the browser info or not.
- {noformat}Include data about your current environment, like the browser and page URL. This helps us understand your feedback better.{noformat}

As a user who is collecting this information, we'd like to hide the check box field so that customers don't have an option to not provide the environment data.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to remove "collect browser info" check box in Issue Collector.
-  !image-2016-08-16-22-11-41-628.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide an option to remove "collect browser info" check box in Issue Collector

h3. Problem Definition
There is no documentation on how to execute REST API using [PL SQL|https://oracle-base.com/articles/misc/oracle-rest-data-services-ords-create-basic-rest-web-services-using-plsql]

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide documentation for REST API using PL SQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62244].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, users can login into JIRA using the same username concurrently from different browser/machine. For some organization, this could be flagged as a security breach since we are allowing _could_ be 2 different users at the same time. One of the examples is a JIRA user might have an idea that he is hacked if when he logs in and there is a warning message saying that he is already logged into JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a feature where JIRA Administrator can choose to allow/block concurrent user sessions.
fields.summary: Block multiple logins from same username
Updating of Field Layouts is an expensive process

h3. Problem Definition
It would be helpful if a user with the iOS app could view a different set of users from the main dashboard. Currently, it appears to only be recently viewed issues, but if you could select a specific project, or do custom advanced searches, create your own filter, etc. that would be very useful.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a way to view open issues in a specific project
* Custom Searches / Advanced searches
fields.summary: Ability to view more issues on app dashboard than simply recently viewed

fields.description:

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, any JIRA Administrative user has permissions to delete a project. Projects are not recoverable especially in JIRA Cloud, so this can cause a lot of issues.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a *Delete Project* permission separate from administrators so that only specific trusted users will have the ability to delete an entire project.
fields.summary: Provide ability to restrict Delete Project permissions
Option to more information of linked issues in the issue navigator.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62233].
  {panel}

h3. *Symptoms*

When customer attach a JPEG image via shortcut key "Ctrl + V" to a JIRA issue in IE 11, JIRA will auto convert the image type to PNG and the image is unable to load in Internet Explore 11 browser. This issue only happen in IE browser and is not happen for chrome browser.

If attach a JPEG image via shortcut key "Ctrl + V" to a JIRA issue in Chrome browser, the image is able to preview in IE11.
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Login JIRA with IE 11 browser.
 # Open a JIRA issue
 # Google a JPEG image
 # Right click > Copy Image
 # locate back to JIRA issue
 # Enter "Ctrl + V" to attach image
 # Click the image to preview in JIRA issue.
h3. *Expected behavior*


Image is previewed without any error.
 !error.png|thumbnail!
h3. *Actual behavior*

JIRA fail to load the image
 !error 2.png|thumbnail!
h3. *Workaround 1*
h3. Upload image from *More* >> *Attach files* or click the *browse* from Attachments section.

 
h3. *Workaround 2*

Use other browser.
fields.summary: Image unable to load when attaching JPEG image with Ctrl + V in IE11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62230].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
We have Statuses mapped in these 3 categories: *to do*, *in progress*, *done*. Nowadays if you create a status, i.e: "Test Phase", let's say this status is present in multiple projects, you'll have to set a status category, it is restricted that the same status be as "in progress"  in all projects. There might be teams where the status "test phase" should be "done" for them and for other teams it should be "in progress", due to process needs.

h3. Suggested Solution
Set the same status to have different categories on a project basis.


h3. Workaround 
Found no workaround.
fields.summary: Map statuses by project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62229].
  {panel}

*Business Case:* We support 65+ small web applications, and in order to know which issue is for what application, we are using components.  The thought of creating 65+ JIRA projects (and growing) didn't work, and labels did not work either so we decided to use components. This has proven to be very effective. However, now we would like to know more information about the component, but we are limited to the out-of-the-box fields.

*Ask:* We would like to have the ability to add custom fields to the component. Examples would be URL links, General Text fields, Dates, Email, just to name a few.  When looking at the schema, there is no relationship between the Component Table and the Custom Field Table. Could that be added? OR could you add more fields, such as what was state earlier directly to the table.

Thank you very much,

Karen (GRAINGER)
fields.summary: Abiltiy to add custom fields to Component - directly to table or via relationship to custom field table)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62226].
  {panel}

There is a new permission scheme in JIRA 7.2 
v7.2.0-RC-20160801091245#72002-sha1:b623912

Best practice is that schemes are named with their type of scheme, e.g. "XYZ Permission Scheme" not "XYZ Scheme". This is because there are many places in JIRA admin pages where having the scheme type is a useful context.

Suggestion: at secure/admin/ViewPermissionSchemes.jspa replace

Default software scheme
Default scheme for Software projects.

with the text:

Default Software Permission Scheme
This is the default scheme for Software projects.
fields.summary: Name of Permission scheme is confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62225].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When running a JIRA instance on a Google Container Engine behind the google http load balancer, if users try to remove a permission from a permission scheme, the http balacer will reject it as "malformed". 

According to the [RFC 2616|https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt]

"A server SHOULD read and forward a message-body on any request; if the request method does not include defined semantics for an entity-body, then the message-body SHOULD be ignored when handling the request"
fields.summary: Malformed request error when editing permission schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62221].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When a filter is shared with disabled groups, if someone tries to change the ownership from that filter, it fails without throwing errors on the UI and no logs about it can be seen on {{catalina.out}} either

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to {{Administration > System > Shared Filters}}
# Search for a filter shared with disabled groups
# Click on {{Cog Icon > Change Owner}} and try changing the ownership on the UI

h3. Expected Results

The ownership from the filter is successfully changed.

h3. Actual Results

The filter ownership stays the same and no errors are thrown.

h3.Workaround

The following can be done to correct this:

# Backup JIRA using the [XML Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/backing-up-data-185729581.html#BackingUpData-UsingJIRA%27sXMLbackuputility] utility or your native database tools.
# Stop JIRA
# Run the following command to delete associations to inactive groups: {code:sql}delete from sharepermissions
where sharetype = 'group'
and param1 not in (select group_name from cwd_group G join cwd_directory D on D.id = G.directory_id where D.active = 1){code}

After that, start JIRA again and change the filter ownership.
fields.summary: Change filter owner fails silently for disabled groups

h3. Summary

In the exported Excel sheet of a search filter, Issue Link Fields with multiple links shows in multiple column with the heading Outward issue link (Blocks), Outward issue link (Cloners), Outward issue link (Duplicate) and Outward issue link (Relates)

h3. How to Replicate

# Go to Search Filter
# Filter Projects which contains multiple Link Issues
# Export (CSV, All Fields) or (Export (CSV, Current Fields)
# Link Issue Column shows multiple 

h3. Expected Result:
Value on the heading for Link shows the name same as UI in a single column

eg. Link issues with single column

h3. Actual Result:
Value on the heading for Link Issues fields shows in multiple columns:

Eg. Outward issue link (Blocks) | Outward issue link (Cloners) | Outward issue link (Duplicate) | Outward issue link (Relates)

And repeated Columns if there are multiple value in the same column:
Eg.  Outward issue link (Blocks) | Outward issue link (Cloners) | Outward issue link (Duplicate) | *Outward issue link (Relates) | Outward issue link (Relates) | Outward issue link (Relates)*

{panel}
fields.summary: Export (CSV, All Fields) and Export (CSV, Current Fields) Issue link value shows in multiple column

{panel:title=Summary|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}

h3. Summary

In the exported Excel sheet of a search filter, the custom fields in heading shows 'Custom field (<field name>)'

h3. How to Replicate

# Go to Search Filter
# Filter Projects which contains Custom Fields
# Export (CSV, All Fields) or (Export (CSV, Current Fields)
# 'Custom field (<field name>)' will show on the Custom Field Header

h3. Expected Result:
Value on the heading for Custom Fields in the shows the name same as UI  

h3. Actual Result:
Value on the heading for Custom Fields in the shows the 'Custom field (<field name>)'

Eg. Custom Field is "Reference"
In the UI shows "Reference"
In the Excel shows 'Custom field (Reference)'

h3. Workaround

* As a workaroud you can use the Export HTML Report (current field/all fields). You can then edit the name of the file from <filename>.html to <filename>.xls and it should open up in your spreadsheet program. You may run into this bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61891

{panel}
fields.summary: Export (CSV, All Fields) and Export (CSV, Current Fields) shows the heading as 'Custom field (<field name>)'

h3. Summary
For a logged in user, the /myself API should return the user's email address. At the moment, it may return an obfuscated email address (if that setting has been enabled).

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable obfuscated email address setting
# Request /rest/api/2/myself

h3. Expected Results
The email address should be returned (e.g. adrizen@atlassian.com)

h3. Actual Results
"adrizen at atlassian dot com" is returned
 
h3. Notes
The profile page UI corrects for this problem

h3.Workaround
Remove the obfuscation on the UI layer.

Trailing whitespace can cause a lot of confusion in both the email address (mail handlers will not be able to find users/reporters) and usernames (people struggle to log in).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62204].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The unattended upgrade will allow for the installer responses to be automated, however once the instance is setup there's no automated configuration after this.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a method to use a pre-existing database configuration and install certain plugins after install.
 
h3. Workaround 

One sample workaround would be to script this, for example:

# Create another database and copy the data from the existing one.
# Download the standalone installer.
# Install it with the pre-answered responses.
# Stop the instance.
# Edit the {{server.xml}} as appropriate.
# Update {{dbconfig.xml}} with the new database.
# Populate {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} with the required plugins.
# Start up the instance, which will then upgrade the data (or simply start with it), and enable the plugins.
fields.summary: Expand the unattended upgrade install process to allow for installation of plugins and additional configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition

As a developer I don't have easy visibility of the JavaScript API available in JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide API documentation similar to what there is for Connect, e.g.: https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/javascript/module-jira.html
fields.summary: Create public documentation for our JavaScript API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62199].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When using their own domain to send notification to JIRA Users, Atlassian Cloud customers need to add an SPF record, with the Cloud ip ranges, to make sure the notifications are not bounced by other email providers.
Having to adjust SPF record every time the ip range is changed is not ideal. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Create an SPF DNS entry for the Cloud ip range, for example _cloudrange.atlassian.com. (like _spf.google.com)

This would enable customers to refer to the SPF DNS and avoid the need to adjust their DNS record, when the Cloud ip range is changed.
 
h3. Workaround

Add the ip range, mentioned in https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html, to the SPF record 
Adjust the record every time the ip range is adjusted.
fields.summary: SPF DNS for Cloud ip range

h3. Summary
If a search result provides more than 1000 issues, when you try to click on the page with issues beyond 1000 results, the screen fades to opaque white and doesn't error at all.

This is likely due to the search limit, but there's no error to say why it might be doing this.

There's a feature request at JRA-45639 to display more than 1000 results, but it claims there is an error seen. On my particular instance, there is no error.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.217.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search JIRA results on an instance with more than 1000 issues. A good option would be to show all issues.
# Navigate through pagination until you reach the results with more than 1000 issues (usually about page 21)
#* Or, go to this link and click No.21 https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=&startIndex=950
# The screen will fade to white and freeze.

h3. Expected Results
Some kind of error message saying a limit has reached.

h3. Actual Results
* No error on screen
* No error in logs
* No error in Dev Tools.

h3.Workaround
No current workaround
fields.summary: When max search results limit is reached, there is no error.

h3. Summary
When a webhook with Variable Substitution is configured, the variable substitution doesn't work when worklog events are fired. It works fine when issue related or comments related events are fired

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an webhook as follows
#* Webhooks URL: append any variable substitution to a valid URL
#** In my case, I used Requestb.in with the _project.id_ variable
{noformat}http://requestb.in/r6eynvr6?${project.id}{noformat}
#* Issue related events
#** Issue: created, updated
#** Comment: created, updated
#** Worlog: created,updated
!webhooks.png|thumbnail! 
# Log work on an issue which will trigger the webhooks.

h3. Expected Results
# The webhooks will include the variable when posting it

h3. Actual Results
# The webhooks doesn't include any variable for this event
!requestbin1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
# It works fine when updating the issue or commenting on an issue
!requestbin2.png|thumbnail!
# Doesn't affect JIRA 6.4.14

h3.Workaround
Instead of using Worklog events, use the *Issue: Worklog changed* event
fields.summary: Variable Substitution in webhooks URL isn't working for "Worklog" related events

fields.description:

h3. Problem Definition

As a System Admin user, I have been given a license key which I want to apply. I know how to find features of JIRA using the "gg" command. 

There are currently three locations in which a License can be applied: 
 # Through the UPM for Add-ons. 
 # The Applications page. 

The "Manage all your licenses" link takes the user to [https://my.atlassian.com|https://my.atlassian.com/]

If there is a problem, the product directs the Administrator to raise an issue with Technical Support, where as some in-product guidance might be able to solve the admin user's problem faster.
h3. Suggested Solution

In the event that a license that has been applied is for the wrong product, it would be good to report an error and allow the user to apply the license to the correct product with one click.

Alternatively, give the admin user a place to manage *all* licenses in a simplified way.
h3. Workaround 

N/A
fields.summary: Simplify the Interface for applying a license

  {panel}

h3. Summary

When a change is made to an issue security scheme, nothing is logged in the Audit Log. This means that an administrator could add themselves to a security scheme, look at confidential data, then remove themselves from that scheme without any record of that happening.

This is inconsistent with the other contents of the Audit log, such as keeping a record of Permission Scheme changes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Issue Security for a project.
# Make changes to the Issue Security Scheme.
# Check the Audit Log.

h3. Expected Results

There would be a record of the changes made, consistent with those made to permission schemes.

h3. Actual Results

No new entries are added to the Audit Log.
fields.summary: Issue Security Scheme Changes Are Not Reported In Audit Log

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62184].
  {panel}

The 'Average Time in Status' gadget displays the following text in it:

"This chart shows the average *time spent* in a status for all resolved issues over the past 30 days."

The chart represents the average time a group of issues remained on each status until their resolution date.

However, 'time spent' can be misunderstood as the Time Spent work-logged hours (time tracking).

For disambiguation, I'd suggest to reword that phrase to avoiding the usage of 'time spent' on it, both inside the gadget and in this [documentation page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-use-average-time-in-status-gadget-776998092.html], which states:

"2. This gadget will only show the average *time spent* on the selected statuses for issues that are resolved with a resolution set on the same day. For example, there are 10 issues resolved on March 16, the total *time spent* on each selected status will be divided by 10 issues, despite when these issues are created.
 (...)
 8. The average *time spent* in each status for all resolved issues on the same day will show up in the graph:"
fields.summary: Reword text of 'Average Time In Status' gadget

Could you please fix a statement about JIRA's End of Life in [our policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-end-of-life-policy-201851003.html]?

[This announcement on October 22, 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/10/important-support-policy-change/] said,

bq. the new policy will not affect any previously published EOL dates for existing releases.

and JIRA 6.3.8 was released on *October 13, 2014*. That's why JIRA 6.3.x is supposed to be supported until *October 13, 2016* at least.

Could you please add *JIRA 6.3* to the list in [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-end-of-life-policy-201851003.html]?
Additionally, please update the following example in the page to the appropriate one.

bq. Atlassian supports major versions for two years after the first major iteration of that version was released (for example, we support JIRA 6.3.x for 2 years after JIRA 6.3.0 was released).

Cheers,
Yuki
fields.summary: Please fix a statement about JIRA's End of Life?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62153].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The "Recently Created Chart" Gadget on a JIRA Dashboard shows Issues that were created in the current month shifted back into the previous month if the User's Profile has a Timezone Offset later than the Server's Default Timezone.

This causes confusion for users in other regions where their Time Zones differe from the Server who are using these Gadgets
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 1000.217.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit dashboard and include a "Recently Created Chart" gadget
 ** Set a Project/Filter and a Period of 'Monthly'
 # Create Issues in the Same Project used by the gadget
 # Change your Profile Time Zone so that it is at least -1 hour to the Server's Default; ie if Chicago, set Time Zone to Denver; if Default is New York, set to Chicago/Mexico City,  etc.
 # Refresh the Dashboard

h3. Expected Results

Gadget shows issues created in Current Month in the Column for the Current Month

!1.ServerDefaultOffset-ChicagoGMT-6.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Testing in the current month of August and setting Time Zone to Denver (rather than my Server's Default of Chicago(GMT-6)) , issues created today are shown in the Gadget to be created in July:

!2.Manual-Denver_GMT-7.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

In a Customer's instance, this is also affecting the 'Daily' period where issues created Today appear on Yesterday's Date 

Found that if a GMT Offset was used that is the same as the Server's Offset; Chicago is GMT-6, if manually selecting GMT-6, the Gadget does not display correctly:
 !5.Manual-GMT-6.png|thumbnail!

However a Manual Offset of GMT-5 or going to +1 hour (or more) to the Server's Default Time Zone, the Gadget displays correctly:
 Manually set Time Zone to GMT-5
 !6.Manual-GMT-5.png|thumbnail!

Manually set Time Zone to New York:
 !3.Manual-NY_GMT-5.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Users in a Different Time Zone See Recently Created Chart Off by One Day/Month

h3. Problem Definition
The same custom field might be used in two different projects, but the select lists or multi check box option requirements could be different for each project. Thus, users must create a separate custom field with a different name to meet the criteria for the separate projects' field options, since it's not recommended to create multiple fields with the same name. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create the ability to dynamically create separate field options depending on context - when associated with a specific screen or transition.  

h3. Workaround 
The only workaround is to create a separate custom field with a slightly different name in order to achieve separate field options.
fields.summary: Dynamic field options

h3. Summary
The [JIRA Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Supported+platforms] documentation mentions a *Minimum screen resolution of 1024 x 768 (when browsers are maximized).*

However, when trying to refine a Cumulative Flow Diagram using the "*Refine Report*" functionality, a pop up appears with all the Quick Filters configured for the board. But users are unable to view all the filters as shown in the images below.

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results 
# The *Refine Report* seems to be distorted and missing a few *Quick Filters* as shown in the image below:

Change the Display Resolution to a resolution higher than the supported --> 1024 x 768

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62132].

Our team manages deployments for all our cloud customers. As such, I'm marking this request for improved platform support as invalid.

We have a related Jira Server ticket for this issue, see linked issues and watch that for updates on our [Jira Server and Data Center products here|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62132].

Thanks!

Steve King
Product Manager
  {panel}

Linux distributions can be automatically configured during provisioning with kickstart. It is then possible to provision with tools like Foreman and Puppet a server which has Jira installed.
But unfortunately, Jira still needs manual setup afterwards - license, administration user etc.

It would be really cool if Jira (and the other Atlassian applications) would recognize some kind of bootstrapping file in the home folder, which has instructions about the setup: database name, license, users, application links etc. etc.

Jira should then on first boot, provideded there is no information in the database and in the home folder, load this configuration file and do the bootstrapping without any manual intervention.

Basically, the goal would be to automatically provision a VM and afterwards have a running Jira, where a administrator can log into.
fields.summary: Automatic bootstrapping of installation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62122].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Due to the removal of certain plugins within JIRA Cloud, such as the JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions, certain parts of the code have been moved into JIRA Cloud. This is detailed further in [JIRA Miscellaneous Workflow Extensions (JMWE) removal from JIRA Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-miscellaneous-workflow-extensions-jmwe-removal-from-jira-cloud-815262011.html]. However, some of the code changes have not made it into JIRA Server, so when migrating from Cloud to Server the workflows will be broken as they reference classes that do not exist.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a workflow with JMWE 'Fields Required' validator or the 'set issue security from role' post-function.
 # Export the instance to Server.
 # Install JMWE plugin.
 # Try to use the workflow.

h3. Expected Results

The workflow proceeds as normal.
h3. Actual Results

The workflow fails to transition with the below error:
{noformat}
[c.a.jira.workflow.DefaultOSWorkflowConfigurator] Could not load class 'com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.FieldRequiredValidator'
{noformat}
Or
{noformat}
2016-10-23 15:54:58,073 ProjectImport: CreateIssues:thread-3 ERROR sysadmin 954x14300x1 v23cek 10.0.0.2 /secure/admin/ProjectImportSummary.jspa [c.a.jira.workflow.DefaultOSWorkflowConfigurator] Could not load class 'com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.SetIssueSecurityFromRoleFunction'
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

This can be worked around by renaming the new class names back to the old class names. For example renaming {{com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.FieldRequiredValidator}} to {{com.innovalog.jmwe.plugins.validators.FieldRequiredValidator}} in the workflows will fix the problem.

h3. Notes

Reviewing the XML backups before and after the change shows the problem is obvious - the class name has changed:
{code:java|title=After}
			<validator name="" type="class">
              <arg name="contextHandling"></arg>
              <arg name="hidFieldsList">customfield_13600</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage"></arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.FieldRequiredValidator</arg>
            </validator>
            <validator name="" type="class">
              <arg name="contextHandling"></arg>
              <arg name="hidFieldsList">customfield_12719</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage">.</arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.FieldRequiredValidator</arg>
            </validator>
{code}
{code:java|title=Before}
			<validator name="" type="class">
			
              <arg name="fieldKey">customfield_13600</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage"></arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.innovalog.jmwe.plugins.validators.FieldRequiredValidator</arg>
            </validator>
            <validator name="" type="class">
			
              <arg name="fieldKey">customfield_12719</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage"></arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.innovalog.jmwe.plugins.validators.FieldRequiredValidator</arg>
            </validator>
{code}
The below contains a summary of changes:

||From||To||
|{{com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.FieldRequiredValidator}}|{{com.innovalog.jmwe.plugins.validators.FieldRequiredValidator}}|
|{{com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.SetIssueSecurityFromRoleFunction}}|{{com.innovalog.jmwe.plugins.functions.SetIssueSecurityFromRoleFunction}}|
fields.summary: Export from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server fails due to Jira Misc Workflow Extensions changes

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62116].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the upgrade documentation for [JIRA Software|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Upgrading+JIRA+applications+using+a+rapid+upgrade+method], has the following checklist: {{Check for known issues - Use the [JIRA Knowledge Base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB] to search for any issues in the new version that will affect you.}}
* However,  this will link Admins to the general KB site, where it's rather difficult for the admins to search for the known issue for a particular version of JIRA. As the search result will provide a vast, inaccurate result.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Currently, in our upgrade notes, there is already a section for [known issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-2-x-upgrade-notes-834230197.html#JIRASoftware7.2.xupgradenotes-Informationforadministrators].
* I would suggest that we link Admins to this section instead rather than to the Knowlege Base
* Improve the 'Known Issue' section as well to be up to date to ensure a list of known issue to be retrieved from JAC 
 
h3. Workaround 
* Access the upgrade notes directly
* Raise a support ticket to get updates from Support Engineer
fields.summary: Improvement on upgrading JIRA documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62115].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 08 November 2016| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#cccccc| titleBGColor=#dddddd| bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience.

There are two main use cases that we have observed amongst our users that concern this functionality:
 1. Exporting / importing issues
 2. Data Reporting

The CSV Export that was introduced in the 7.2 release addresses the first use case.
 The second one used to be addressed by the Excel (HTML) export functionality however, as you know, we decided to remove it and observed it had negative impact on our users who took advantage of the Excel (HTML) form, where CSV Export did not solve their needs (please refer to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61891 for background).

To address this challenge we're considering bringing back the Excel (HTML) functionality as HTML Export (so with .html extension and not the .xls). We see the following benefits of such solution:
 * Mitigating the dependecy on Microsoft's requirements related to downloading and opening an HTML file with .xls extension
 * Ability to use the rich HTML table for immediate reporting purposes (the only difference is that if you wanted to open it in Excel you would need to change the downloaded file extension to .xls or right click on the downloaded file and select Open with > Excel or open the file from MS Excel)
 * Ability to use the well-know table format including hyperlinks and attachments

Note: By default the file would be opened in a web browser after it's downloaded.

On top of it we will keep addressing the outstanding shortcomings of CSV Export.

We would like to find out if that approach would solve majority of your concerns related to removal of the old Excel (HTML) export option.

Thanks again for your help and feedback!
 Jakub Lazinski
 Product Manager, JIRA
{panel}
 

*Original request description*

Since exporting to *Excel (HTML)* will be disabled soon, we would like customers to share their feedbacks on the export to *Excel (CSV)*.

Exporting to *Excel (HTML)* will be removed because of:
 - --JRA-61891--
fields.summary: Feedback on  the new "Export to CSV" functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62112].
  {panel}

* https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis/jira-rest-apis

In regards to the above link, the documentation is outdated and there are several improvements which can be made to make it easier for users (which includes both new developers and seasoned developers) to understand.

Some of the improvements would be 
# Highlighting that the [Atlassian Developer Toolbox|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.devrel.developer-toolbox-plugin/server/overview] is *NOT* compatible with JIRA7
#* Users might spend time trying to download/install/get it to work only to find out that it is not compatible with later versions of JIRA
# Using standard port number in the description
#* Use port 8080 in the examples since the example is for creating issues in JIRA, instead of a random port number of 2990 which can be misleading
fields.summary: Improve REST API documentation for Developers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62109].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

For reporting purposes it would be good if the Two-Dimensional gadget would allow to summarize values, much as an Excel Pivot table enables this possibility.

h3. Suggested Solution

In our scrum team, we use story points to measure the "weight" of issues and I have to make the sums of Story points on different levels:
- How much Story Points are assigned to developer X?
- How much Story Points are open for component Y?
- How much Story Points are scheduled for Release Z?
I can consult values like this in the GreenHopper screens, but this functionality is not usable for reporting purposes,
So, if the two dimensional gadget would allow to make the sum of custom values, it would also be possible to make reports for Story Points.
 
h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Make it possible to summarize Story Points, and other custom fields, in Two Dimensional Gadget or other statistics view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62103].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Using JAWS or NVDA, input elements with role="combobox" are described only as:
'combo box collapsed and autocomplete editable blank' for one with nothing pre-selected
or
'combo box collapsed and autocomplete editable selected <Whatever is selected>'

Input elements with role="combobox" have a different id than the previous label for element.

A concrete example is <label for="project"></label>
The actual active element is <input id="project-field"></input> whereas the element labeled as "project" is a hidden input element.

This means that combobox selection elements, such as Project, Issue Type, Priority, Components/s, Reporter, Assignee, Labels, Epic Link, Sprint, and many more are indistinguishable from each other when read aloud:

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any combobox selection elements, such as Project, Issue Type, Priority, Components/s, Reporter, Assignee, Labels, Epic Link and Sprint using JAWS or NVDA

h3. Expected Results
These should be distinguishable from each other when read aloud. 

h3. Actual Results
They're indistinguishable. 

h3. Notes (suggested solutions)
* change the label for id so it matches the id for the actual input element that has role="combobox"
* swap the labels for the the style="display: none;" hidden input element with the element that has role="combobox", so the combobox one gets id "project" and the hidden input element gets the "project-field" id instead.
* Explicitly assign an aria-label attribute for each of the combobox elements, so for the project label, combobox would have aria-label="project".
fields.summary: Accessibility issue for comboboxes

h3. Problem Definition

We have seen that [release()|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/latest/com/atlassian/jira/issue/index/IssueIndexManager.html#release()] method (via 7.x source code) is always present and no more public and only the [IssueIndexingService|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.1.9/com/atlassian/jira/issue/index/IssueIndexingService.html] is available, without access to this method.

h3. Suggested Solution

Providing the release() method in REST API will open it in the IssueIndexingService
fields.summary: Create a new API for release() method in public

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62100].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when Sprint is created in Backlog but not yet started. The issues that are marked as done, are removed from Backlog. When the sprint is started those issues are in the last column which is expected behaviour. 

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would want to have information of the issues that are completed in the Sprint that is not started yet, similarly like in the case with active sprints. 

In the screenshot below we can see that issues which are completed in the Active Sprint are shown with a strike-through. For Sprint that hasn't started yet, the issues are removed from Backlog. 

 !sprint in backlog.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3. Workaround 

An information about issues that have been completed outside of the Sprint Scope can be seen in the Burndown Chart.
fields.summary: Show done issues in Backlog view for issues which are part of Sprint that haven't started yet

h3. Problem Definition

Currently in JIRA, there's no feature to generate Epic Sum report and export the report to Excel document.

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Workaround 

It's possible to generate Epic Sum using [this|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/aptis.plugins.epicSumUp/server/overview] plugin but there's no workaround to import the report to Excel document.
fields.summary: Generate Epic Sum report and export the report to Excel

h3. Summary
Our current JIRA Data Center documentation does not mention the configuration required to set the proxyName, ProxyPort, etc that should be set in the connector details within the server.xml. 

h3. Notes
This can be seen in: [Installing JIRA Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/installing-jira-data-center-802592197.html] documentation. Where information about a load balancer is detailed, but no recommendation on proxy connector configuration is made.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62083].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Occurs when the permission scheme still had JSD permissions but JSD has been uninstalled.

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Install Jira Core and JSD
 # Create a JSD project
 # Deactivate JSD
 # Edit JSD permission scheme

h3. Expected Result
Permission scheme is editable.

h3. Actual Result
Permission scheme is showing a blank page:
{noformat}
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715437500 2016-07-28 15:01:40,710 http-nio-2992-exec-11 ERROR sysadmin 901x18908x1 1jkiseq 104.192.142.137 /rest/internal/2/managedpermissionscheme/10101 [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715439500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715440500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.buildGrants(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:321)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715440500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.lambda$generatePermissionSchemeBean$4(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:228)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715482500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl$$Lambda$2760/29273610.apply(Unknown Source)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715483500 	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$8.transform(Iterators.java:799)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715483500 	at com.google.common.collect.TransformedIterator.next(TransformedIterator.java:48)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715491500 	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators.addAll(Iterators.java:362)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715491500 	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:160)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715492500 	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:144)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715501500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.generatePermissionSchemeBean(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:242)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715501500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.getManagedPermissionScheme(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:108)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715502500 	... 2 filtered
{noformat}

h3. Note
 * Not relate to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/nullpointerexception-on-editing-permission-scheme-826891686.html]
 * Root cause is *Service desk customer - portal access* is still being used
 * *Project Role (Service Desk Team)* and *Project Role (Service Desk Collaborators)* are not affected



h3. Workaround
 # Install JSD > Remove *Service desk customer - portal access* from the permission schemes > Uninstall JSD; *OR*
 # Update the database:
{noformat}
delete from schemepermissions where perm_type = 'sd.customer.portal.only';
{noformat}
fields.summary: Edit Permission Scheme Shows Blank Page

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when setting up a Password Policy, there's no way to set up different policies for different user groups.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Allow an option to set up different Password Policies for different user groups. As an exmaple, I could have different requirements for users that acces the application from whitin the same network versus for users that access JIRA from and external source.
fields.summary: Add group option to Password Policies

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62078].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When looking at a list of issues returned from a JQL on the issue navigator or on a subscription that are ordered by rank, I want to be able to reference them by a # value, since ranks do not show a numerical value.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Add a column that shows a numerical value depending on the number of issues returned so they can be easily referenced. For example, a query returns 19 issues, the column would classify these issues from 1 to 19 based on their ranking.
fields.summary: Add a numerical column for referencing ranked issues returned on a JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62077].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Road map gadget displays wrong results when the resolution field is not visible.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In field configuration set resolution field to hide
# create a version
# Add a collection of issues to that version, 9 in this example
# Set the status of some of those issues to 'in progress'. 5 in this example
# Marked 2 issues in this example to done.
# Note that the road map gadget now shows 3 of 9 issues resolved instead of 2 of 9 as expected. Click on the version in the road map gadget, note that the version report numbers do not match the count shown on the gadget. The version report is correct the gadget is not.

 !gadget1.png|thumbnail! 
 !2016-07-29_0957.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
The road map gadget should correctly reflect the number of issues in the done status.

h3. Actual Results
The number on the gadget is incorrectly including issues in 'To do' and 'In progress' statuses.
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
The only work around is to make the resolution field visible on the issue and then change the status of the issue to any status.  The status change updates the gadget.  You can then change the status of the issue immediately back to the original status.
fields.summary: Road Map Gadget is displaying wrong results
